author: gua00va
content: I saw the portal network project. Seems interesting. Does anyone know what exactly the project around glados is ?

author: gzanitti
content: <@686695036733227017> I would like to explore more ideas related to compilers and virtual machines. Do you know any other team I should contact (apart from Ipsilon)?

author: mariohavel
content:
Depends on what you are interested in.. There are teams working on compilers for Solidity, Fe, Vyper, then there are zkevms and zk native VMs with their own langs but that would go outside of EPF scope. You can also checkout some EVM related EIPs and who worked on them because there are different people contributing towards it, not just Ipsilon, e.g. Uniswap labs..

But generally, you don't need to know what team does what, the goal now is to preperly research the topic and there can be various people who can help you during the project execution.

author: mariohavel
content: Office Hours recording from yesterday just dropped! If you missed it and you are interested in what are fellows going to work on, check it out. https://drive.google.com/file/d/1A5qAofBdn-N3KcoFDNSE3AFa7e-wIB2Q

author: alemaz98
content:

author: mariohavel
content: I muted my mic for the recording because I was in public place and wanted to make sure the sound is clean. I didn't talk much anyway so I just kept it tuned down, I believe nothing important is missing

author: lightclient
content: Becoming a regular reth contributor is a fantastic EPF project

author: lightclient
content: as you work on easy issues you'll gain confidence + context that will allow you to tackle bigger projects in reth
